subject: RE: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
msgSnippet: Elliotte, I will fork a VM and check the return code, just like the tests for return codes in JUnit 3.8.x. Take care, Kent Beck Three Rivers Institute
messageBody:
Elliotte,

I will fork a VM and check the return code, just like the tests for return codes in JUnit 3.8.x.

Take care,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold
> Sent: Thursday, October 13, 2005 4:20 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs
> within another test
>
> Kent Beck wrote:
>
> > I checked with JUnit 4 and noticed that it doesn't call
> System.exit(), so
> > that's something we need to fix.
>
> Now how are you going to write a test case for that? :-)
> (only half joking)
>
>
